meanings.sent1: After waking up, the hypnotist decided to rehypnotize the volunteer for another demonstration.
meanings.sent2: The therapist was rehypnotizing the patient to help them overcome their fear of flying.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he could rehypnotize the audience to make them believe they were chickens.
meanings.sent4: The idea of rehypnotizing someone to forget their past mistakes seemed like a magical solution.
meanings.sent5: She had a special technique for rehypnotizing people that made her sessions very effective.

meanings.definition: To put someone back into a hypnotic state.
meanings.sent1: The hypnotist was rehypnotizing the audience members one by one during the show.
meanings.sent2: He was skilled at rehypnotizing his clients to help them relax and reduce stress.
meanings.sent3: The hypnotist accidentally rehypnotized himself during a practice session.
meanings.sent4: The calming music in the background was rehypnotizing the listeners into a peaceful state.
meanings.sent5: The therapist's soothing voice was rehypnotizing the patient into a deep sleep.
